alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Sarpy; Washington (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 10:31AM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pottawattamie, southwestern Harrison, north central Sarpy, southeastern Washington and eastern Douglas Counties through 1100 AM CST... At 1031 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Millard, or 5 miles west of Omaha, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Omaha around 1040 AM CST. Fort Calhoun around 1045 AM CST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Missouri Valley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 61 and 82. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 443 and 448. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
